lead_paragraph: New York is changing a rule that requires an entire family to be present at the city’s intake center when reapplying to get a spot in a shelter.

headline.print_headline: City Alters a School Policy to Aid Homeless Families
headline.main: Under New Policy for Homeless Families, Children Can Miss Less School

snippet: New York is changing a rule that requires an entire family to be present at the city’s intake center when reapplying to get a spot in a shelter....
abstract: New York City's Dept of Homeless Services changes policies, eliminating requirement that children must accompany families when they are reapplying for spot in shelter system for night; aim of new policy is to disrupt children's lives as little as possible, in particular allowing them to stick to school schedules.
